H0.text: Who was made Archbishop of Capetown in 1986. Desmond Tutu

H1.text: Who was made Archbishop of Capetown in 1986. Beyers Naude

H2.text: Who was made Archbishop of Capetown in 1986. Allan Boesak

H3.text: Who was made Archbishop of Capetown in 1986. Mpilo

A4.text: To break deadlock, a bishops' synod met and decided to appoint Tutu.

A5.text: After Philip Russell announced his retirement as the Archbishop of Cape Town, in February 1986 the Black Solidarity Group formed a plan to get Tutu appointed as his replacement.
